intro: Myrmidone filiformis, commonly known as the slender myrmidone, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to regions of South America, particularly in Argentina and Chile. The plant is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically finely divided and aromatic, similar to other members of the carrot family. It often grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
